content:
• Monday, September 24, 2012
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ2 (I, II) earnings call for FQ3 revenue of $336M-$339M and...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ2 (I, II) earnings call for FQ3 revenue of $336M-$339M and EPS of $0.28-$0.29, slightly below a consensus of $340.1M and $0.30. For FY13 (ends Feb. '13), the Linux vendor now expects revenue of $1.32B-$1.33B and EPS of $1.15-$1.17 vs. a consensus of $1.33B and $1.17. Shares -2.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • PNR

    ADT (about to be spun off from Tyco) and Pentair (NYSE:PNR) will replace Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) and...

    ADT (about to be spun off from Tyco) and Pentair (NYSE:PNR) will replace Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) and DeVry (DV) in the S&P 500 as of Sep. 28's close. Lexmark and DeVry will be moved over to the S&P MidCap 400, and RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) and Pentair kicked out to make room. PNR +1.6% AH. LXK -1.2%. DV -2.6%. RSH -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • HR

    Healthcare Realty Trust Incorporated (NYSE:HR) announces an 8M share secondary offering of...

    Healthcare Realty Trust Incorporated (NYSE:HR) announces an 8M share secondary offering of common stock. The company had approximately 78M shares outstanding as of July 25, and intends to use the proceeds to acquire healthcare facilities as well as for other general purposes such as repaying debt. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • PNNT

    PennantPark (NASDAQ:PNNT) files a secondary offering to sell 9M shares of common stock. Morgan...

    PennantPark (NASDAQ:PNNT) files a secondary offering to sell 9M shares of common stock. Morgan Stanley, Goldman, Sachs, JPMorgan Securities and SunTrust are acting as joint bookrunners. Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • FWRD

    Forward Air (NASDAQ:FWRD) cuts its Q3 EPS view to $0.39 - $0.41, down from its prior view of...

    Forward Air (NASDAQ:FWRD) cuts its Q3 EPS view to $0.39 - $0.41, down from its prior view of $0.47 - $0.51, citing weaker August airport-to-airport daily tonnage volumes. The company says that freight volumes started becoming inconsistent in August compared to the prior year and turned negative during the past week. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • FB

    Facebook's (FB -9.1%) plunge managed to trigger short-sale curbs at 12:37PM ET, and from the...

    Facebook's (FB -9.1%) plunge managed to trigger short-sale curbs at 12:37PM ET, and from the looks of things, that helped shares stabilize - 18.1% of Facebook's float was shorted as of Aug. 31, quite impressive for a company of its size. In addition to Barron's and Goldman, Stifel contributed to today's misery: analyst Jordan Rohan forecast a "soft transitional period" for Facebook as PC usage flatlines or shrinks in developed markets while mobile usage grows (ed: hasn't it already started?).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +0.3%) is buying LML Payment Systems (LMLP +81.8%), a provider of...

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD +0.3%) is buying LML Payment Systems (LMLP +81.8%), a provider of online/mobile payment processing and risk management services for SMEs, for $3.45/share in cash, or $102.8M. Digital River, whose e-commerce software business has fallen on hard times, plans to integrate LML's solutions with its own payment processing service, which has historically focused on larger businesses. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • NEPT

    Shares of Neptune Technologies (NASDAQ:NEPT) dip in the post-trading session after the company...

    Shares of Neptune Technologies (NASDAQ:NEPT) dip in the post-trading session after the company files a secondary offering to sell an undisclosed number of shares. RBC Capital Markets and JMP Securities will act as joint book-runners. Shares -5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • OKE

    Oneok Partners (OKS) +3.2% AH after saying it expects 2013 net income to increase 10% to the...

    Oneok Partners (OKS) +3.2% AH after saying it expects 2013 net income to increase 10% to the $935M-$1.015B range vs. previous guidance of $860M-$910M issued in July, reflecting increased higher volumes gathered and processed in the natural gas and natural gas liquids segments. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHKP

    Check Point (CHKP +1.2%) closes higher on a down day after Oppenheimer says its reseller checks...

    Check Point (CHKP +1.2%) closes higher on a down day after Oppenheimer says its reseller checks indicate the firewall vendor should post Q3 results "at least in line" with Street estimates, in spite of recent fears about competition and Europe. The firm also likes a valuation of 13x estimated 2013 EPS and the company's $16.30/share in cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q2 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $323M (+15% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q2 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $323M (+15% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • PAYX

    Paychex (NASDAQ:PAYX): FQ1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $578M (+3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Paychex (NASDAQ:PAYX): FQ1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $578M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CDMO

    Roth Capital steps to the sidelines on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -79%), downgrading it to...

    Roth Capital steps to the sidelines on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -79%), downgrading it to Neutral and removing it from its Focus List due to the uncertainty over the discrepancies in its Phase II study of bavituximab. The firm also skewered its price target on the shares, slashing it to $0.70 from $9.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 8 Comments
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK +2.1%) is initiated with an Overweight rating and $11 price target at...

    Halcon Resources (HK +2.1%) is initiated with an Overweight rating and $11 price target at Barclays, which believes HK's asset base exposes investors to significant production and reserve growth potential in multiple liquids plays, many of which are in the early stages of development.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM

  • Shares of Vivus (VVUSJ -10%) take a hit after Needham cut its price target on the shares earlier...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUSJ -10%) take a hit after Needham cut its price target on the shares earlier today. The company notes that its discussions with management lead them to believe the European regulatory environment is going to be far more restrictive on weight loss drugs than it previously thought. Based on that assumption, it doesn't see Qsymia getting European approval in the near future, and removes those metrics from its pricing models.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • ARCB

    Struggling transport stocks may be enjoying a lift today on Citi's upgrade of the sector. "While...

    Struggling transport stocks may be enjoying a lift today on Citi's upgrade of the sector. "While there have been several negative profit pre-announcements of late, they appear to be priced in already," Citi says, noting transports typically do well from October through April. Trucking stocks: ABFS +6.3%, JBHT +1.7%, ODFL +1.4% CNW +1.4%. Rails: NSC +2%, UNP +1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • FMCN

    Shares of Focus Media (FMCN -4.3%) trade lower as debate still goes back and forth on if a...

    Shares of Focus Media (FMCN -4.3%) trade lower as debate still goes back and forth on if a leverage buyout deal for the company will actually fly. Speculation on the $27 go-private offer continues to also roil options trading on the name and has analysts warning investors to stay on the sidelines until visibility has cleared.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • STR

    Natural gas producer Questar (STR +4%) is among the day's top performers after shares are...

    Natural gas producer Questar (STR +4%) is among the day's top performers after shares are upgraded from Neutral to Buy with a raised $24 target price (from $21) at UBS based on its enviable asset profile, best-in-class returns, proven executive team, strong balance sheet and ongoing dividend growth potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG -3%) shares are lower despite disclosure of SAC Capital's raised 5.5% stake...

    Bill Barrett (BBG -3%) shares are lower despite disclosure of SAC Capital's raised 5.5% stake that's a positive bet on natural gas. Steve Cohen had slashed his Q2 position after BBG lowered production guidance, but in August the company revised estimates upwards. While BBG trades at a premium based on P/E, it's attractive on a P/S basis vs. peers NOG, STR, QEP and SGY.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • DWDP

    A federal appeals court has stayed an injunction against South Korea's Kolon Industries in a...

    A federal appeals court has stayed an injunction against South Korea's Kolon Industries in a trade-secrets battle with DuPont (DD -1.3%). A federal judge last month barred Kolon from producing any para-aramid fibers for 20 years after the company lost a court fight over high-strength synthetic fibers used in products such as Kevlar body armor. The decision means that Kolon can continue selling its Heracron fiber products while it appeals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • OLED

    More on Universal Display (PANL -9%): While Goldman is praising the company today, Canaccord is...

    More on Universal Display (PANL -9%): While Goldman is praising the company today, Canaccord is reiterating a Hold and providing a list of concerns. Among them: 1) The firm thinks PANL's 2012 sales of green OLED materials to Samsung will be $5M-$10M less than the Street expects. 2) It thinks OLED TVs will remain a high-end niche in 2013, and face a "difficult path to cost parity" with LCDs. 3) Checks indicate Samsung is interested in using local suppliers for green material manufacturing.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +6.2%) move higher, with traders saying that a mild short...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +6.2%) move higher, with traders saying that a mild short squeeze is in play. On the fundamental side, while the company's Nook business has been written off by some as doomed by competitive pressures from big players, SA author Peter Larson maintains that its disruptive supply chain management system is an under-appreciated jewel.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • JASO

    JA Solar (JASO -5.2%) has repurchased $89.2M worth of 4.5% convertible senior notes due May...

    JA Solar (JASO -5.2%) has repurchased $89.2M worth of 4.5% convertible senior notes due May 2013. Their face value is well below their principal value, as investors fret over the company's losses. JA, which announced a $100M stock buyback program in June, is trying to prevent getting delisted by the NASDAQ on account of a stock price that has fallen below $1. But not everyone is convinced the company's cash deployments are wise.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • ZNGA

    As is often the case, Zynga (ZNGA -7.6%) is falling in sympathy with Facebook. Shares are once...

    As is often the case, Zynga (ZNGA -7.6%) is falling in sympathy with Facebook. Shares are once more flirting with the $3 level. Some other recent consumer Internet IPOs also aren't faring well. GRPN -3.4%. YELP -4.7%. ANGI -2.6%. Neither, for that matter, is Chinese social networking site Renren (RENN -4.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • LEN

    Homebuilders slip despite a strong report from Lennar (LEN -2%) earlier today. MarketWatch's Sam...

    Homebuilders slip despite a strong report from Lennar (LEN -2%) earlier today. MarketWatch's Sam Mamudi warns that much of the sector has already had a huge bounce, and with a slew of housing data due out this week, most of it is second-tier stuff and already baked into share prices, so we could be in for some heavy profit-taking on some of the bigger movers in the sector: TOL-1%, DHI -1.7%, HOV -1.3%, PHM -1.3%. ETFs: XHB -1.2%, ITB -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • SQBG

    Shares of Martha Stewart Omnimedia (MSO +8.7%) jet higher to hit their highest level in over a...

    Shares of Martha Stewart Omnimedia (MSO +8.7%) jet higher to hit their highest level in over a month. The company is in the middle of an ambitious plan to expand its content - including short-form videos for smartphones and tablets - and maintains it's still on schedule to launch its shops inside J.C. Penney stores in Q1 of 2013 despite the ongoing litigation with Macy's.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: LMLP +82%. LPH +28%. BCOM +20%. RMBS +20%. SKBI +19%. VII +18%. AUDC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: LMLP +82%. LPH +28%. BCOM +20%. RMBS +20%. SKBI +19%. VII +18%. AUDC +17%. CHOP +16%. COGO +15%. RMKR +13%.
    Top 10 Losers: PPHM -77%. QCOR -33%. OTCQB:DLGC -15%. PAMT -12%. BIOF -11%. DHRM -11%. VECO -11%. CCM -10%. SRI -10%. BONA -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -6.4%) is off sharply. Apple's decision to seek U.S. bans on 29 devices...

    Universal Display (PANL -6.4%) is off sharply. Apple's decision to seek U.S. bans on 29 devices from top customer Samsung could be having an impact, given many of those devices use PANL's OLED technology and materials. Goldman reiterated a Buy and $61 target this morning. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • AXAS

    Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -3.8%) says it is encouraged with its latest well results as they...

    Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -3.8%) says it is encouraged with its latest well results as they "validate our aggressive capital program" to develop new oil reserves and production. The Spires well in west Texas is "a step out" from previous production and indicates the potential for a sizable area of higher pressure reservoir.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • GOOG

    The tech sector may be selling off in sympathy with Apple and Facebook, but Google (GOOG +1.5%)...

    The tech sector may be selling off in sympathy with Apple and Facebook, but Google (GOOG +1.5%) is making new highs yet again (previous) following a bullish report from Citi's Mark Mahaney. Mahaney says his Q3 search ad checks are reasonably positive, and (importantly, given recent trends) predicts Google will benefit from improving ad click prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML -6.1%) slumps on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS, which argues the touchscreen...

    Atmel (ATML -6.1%) slumps on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS, which argues the touchscreen controller maker's opportunities for Samsung and Windows 8 hardware have become more limited. Atmel, whose fortunes have been strongly tied to a disappointing high-end Android tablet market, has had a rough year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) is upgraded at Howard Weil even as shares brush against 52-week highs, on...

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) is upgraded at Howard Weil even as shares brush against 52-week highs, on optimism over upcoming Australia LNG project cost updates. Outside of some escalating cost pressures, the firm expects a positive presentation, finding it unlikely CVX would bring investors halfway around the world to highlight timing delays and deteriorating project economics.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CLR

    A Reuters story depicts Continental Resources' (CLR -2.7%) CEO Harold Hamm as a shrewd...

    AReuters story depicts Continental Resources' (CLR -2.7%) CEOHarold Hamm as a shrewd operator, while WSJ weighs in to highlight the company's what's-next dilemma after a string of drilling successes inflated CLR’s share price and Hamm’s personal wealth. Investors are growing nervous about CLR because it's a high-multiple stock, an analyst says; others worry about CLR's spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO -9.4%) tumbles on a downgrade to Sell from Goldman. The firm notes shares are (or...

    Veeco (VECO -9.4%) tumbles on a downgrade to Sell from Goldman. The firm notes shares are (or rather, were) up 68% YTD on expectations of a pickup in equipment demand, and says checks indicate "incremental downside" to LED equipment orders. Veeco shares are discounting a 30%-35% increase in 2013 bookings, Goldman estimates, well above the "flattish" outlook Goldman sees for equipment sales. Rival Aixtron (AIXG -3.1%) is also lower. (Piper estimate cut)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • FB

    A cautious Goldman note could be adding to Facebook's (FB -6.7%) losses this morning. The firm...

    A cautious Goldman note could be adding to Facebook's (FB -6.7%) losses this morning. The firm expects shares to "remain volatile over the next few months" due to the giant Nov. 14 lockup expiration and "the market's allergy to supply." Nonetheless, Goldman is maintaining a Buy, and is encouraged by the higher ad rates associated with new ad products. (Barron's column)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 7 Comments
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.3%) trade higher with news that Toyota is de-emphasizing its...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.3%) trade higher with news that Toyota is de-emphasizing its pure electric vehicle program making for an interesting backdrop. Tesla isn't shy about stating its own conviction on the EV market and is in the midst of setting up retail stores across the U.S. At the moment it has the auto industry press on its side as more extensive reviews of the Model S come out with Wired's 4-day test drive concluding the vehicle's large battery and charging potential should keep "range anxiety" in check.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 10 Comments
  • TPX

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -4.9%) fall even after Longbow Research comes out with a positive...

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -4.9%) fall even after Longbow Research comes out with a positive take on the bedding name. Analysts say the company's sales are outpacing the industry, while it's also keeping its advertising costs relatively flat. If the trend holds, margins could improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P +5%) is rallying following Friday's introduction of the Internet Radio Fairness Act,...

    Pandora (P +5%) is rallying following Friday's introduction of the Internet Radio Fairness Act, a Congressional bill that would allow federal judges to determine Internet radio royalty rates based on their judgement of the value of the covered music - an approach similar to how satellite radio royalties (much lower on average) are determined. Pandora, whose royalty payments made up roughly half of its 2011 revenue, is praising the bill.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK +5.8%) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -0.6%) strike a deal to jointly...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK +5.8%) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -0.6%) strike a deal to jointly develop oil and gas properties in the Sand Wash Basin in northwest Colorado. The companies will own 50% interest each in ~330K acres, with the Shell unit operating most of the properties, and establish an area of mutual interest covering ~850K acres in the basin.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM -2.3%) shares extend Friday's late losses after CEO Hal Kvisle said...

    Talisman Energy (TLM -2.3%) shares extend Friday's late losses after CEO Hal Kvisle said the company isn’t in discussions about selling out. Kvisle aims to identify assets, such as those in the North Sea, that require further investment. TLM agreed with Sinopec in July to invest $1.5B in the North Sea assets in exchange for a 49% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • MNK

    Wall Street reacts to Questor's (QCOR -28%) announcement of a government probe this morning, as...

    Wall Street reacts to Questor's (QCOR -28%) announcement of a government probe this morning, as a host of analysts lower their ratings. Oppenheimer downgrades the stock to Perform, Piper Jaffray cuts it to Neutral and Leerink Swann reduces it to Market Perform. Leerink cites more than just the federal probe, however, saying in its channel checks the reimbursement risks to Acthar are real.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -3%) slumps in response to a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest's Monika...

    Micron (MU -3%) slumps in response to a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest's Monika Garg, who's worried about poor PC demand and DRAM pricing. Garg notes DRAM prices are down 21% over the last 3 months, and expects Micron to "post losses for a couple more quarters." Shares could also be getting hurt by Apple's iPhone 5 data , given acquisition target Elpida is supplying DRAM for the device.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOY +1.9%) shares are moving higher on chatter that GE could be ready to take over...

    Joy Global (JOY +1.9%) shares are moving higher on chatter that GE could be ready to take over the mining company. William Blair's Larry De Maria says a bid from GE is "increasingly likely" in the medium term. "It's a good a time to be looking at acquisitions in a value sense," GE Mining CEO Geoff Knox tells Bloomberg.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • CRUS

    Apple component suppliers trade lower in response to the company's iPhone 5 sales data. CRUS...

    Apple component suppliers trade lower in response to the company's iPhone 5 sales data. CRUS -3.8%. SWKS -2%. AVGO -2.7%. BRCM -1.5%. QCOM -1.5%. TQNT -1.7%. The broader chip sector, which depends a lot on Apple these days, is also underperforming (SOXX -1.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • CTXS

    Citrix (CTXS -4.1%) falls on a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. The firm notes...

    Citrix (CTXS -4.1%) falls on a downgrade to Equal-weight from Morgan Stanley. The firm notes shares of the thin client/virtualization software vendor have risen 34% YTD, and thinks growth tailwinds will diminish next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (CIE -7%) plunges on disappointing news regarding the continued malfunction at its...

    Cobalt Energy (CIE -7%) plunges on disappointing news regarding the continued malfunction at its Cameia #2 well offshore Angola. Until an additional drilling rig is contracted or the current rig is fit for duty, CIE will be unable to conduct a production test or announce production results by year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum (SPPI -3.1%) is at odds with Danish partner TopoTarget over the results of a Phase II...

    Spectrum (SPPI -3.1%) is at odds with Danish partner TopoTarget over the results of a Phase II trial for their lymphoma drug belinostat. TopoTarget says the primary endpoint has been met, as the tumors in at least 20% of patients shrank. However, Spectrum is far more cautious, describing the results as "preliminary" and saying that the full outcome won't be known until all the data is analyzed. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • DNKN

    Dunkin' Brands (DNKN -2.3%) trades lower after ITG Research estimates Q3 revenue for the firm...

    Dunkin' Brands (DNKN -2.3%) trades lower after ITG Research estimates Q3 revenue for the firm will fall $3M short of estimates. Shares briefly dipped below $30, marking the first time in two weeks they dipped below that level.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -6.5%) heads south after announcing a $175M offering of...

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -6.5%) heads south after announcing a $175M offering of convertible senior notes due Oct. 1, 2017. The LED/solar equipment maker, which had $144M in debt on its balance sheet as of June 29, only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 6 Comments
  • LUFK

    Even as Lufkin Industries (LUFK -3.2%) is discussed as a potential takeover target by Bloomberg,...

    Even as Lufkin Industries (LUFK -3.2%) is discussed as a potential takeover target by Bloomberg, shares slump on a Global Hunter downgrade. The firm says red flags came up during its meetings with LUFK officers due to the timing of the start of an automation project in Romania and the continuing lack of pricing improvements despite being essentially sold out.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • IP

    Shares of International (IP +4%) , Rock-Tenn (RKT +6%), and Packaging Corp of America (PKG...

    Shares of International (IP +4%) , Rock-Tenn (RKT +6%), and Packaging Corp of America (PKG +3.7%) jet higher with more support out that containerboard price hikes in the sector are sticking. Credit Suisse is out with a positive note today after Deutsche Bank did the heavy lifting last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • RMBS

    Beaten-down Rambus (RMBS +8.9%) soars after receiving a mixed verdict in its suit against SK...

    Beaten-down Rambus (RMBS +8.9%) soars after receiving a mixed verdict in its suit against SK Hynix. Though finding Rambus guilty of destroying evidence in advance of the case and overturning a prior $397M award in Rambus' favor, a federal district court also ruled Hynix is infringing Rambus' patents, and that the memory IP company is entitled to royalties on them on FRAND terms. (Rambus PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) surges 18.5% after receiving a U.S. patent for its BL-1020 treatment for...

    BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) surges 18.5% after receiving a U.S. patent for its BL-1020 treatment for schizophrenia, which is in Phase II/III trials. The new patent will be valid until 2031, adding nine years to the drug's protection. BioLineRx says BL-1020's market potential has strengthened over the past several months following the failure of rival drugs in late-stage trials. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • LPIH

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH) +36.3% premarket on news it will complete the purchase of the assets of...

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH) +36.3% premarket on news it will complete the purchase of the assets of Huajie Petroleum, a fuel storage depot in China's Shanxi province with a 100K metric ton storage capacity, by the end of this month. LPH will acquire Huajie for a total purchase price of RMB 700M ($110.6M).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • DDMGQ

    Bankrupt Digital Domain (OTCPK:DDMGQ) has sold its Venice, CA and Vancouver studios to a JV...

    Bankrupt Digital Domain (OTCPK:DDMGQ) has sold its Venice, CA and Vancouver studios to a JV owned by China's Galloping Horse and India's Reliance MediaWorks for $30.2M through a bankruptcy option.  The JV's offer is more than twice the size of an earlier bid from P-E firm Searchlight Capital. Digital Domain closed with a market cap of $11.8M on Friday, but bondholders will get first dibs at the company's assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM

  • Market preview: Shares are set to start the week lower, weighed down by concerns about the...

    Market preview: Shares are set to start the week lower, weighed down by concerns about the eurozone debt crisis and falling German business confidence. S&P futures are -0.4%. Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (-86%) is getting slaughtered over a botched Phase II trial, while Questcor Pharmaceuticals is 29% on a government investigation into its promotional practices. More happily, UnitedHealth is set to make its DJIA debut following Kraft's split into two. Later: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook
